answers.answer: The quality of the semen declines as he gets older, but he will always make it so there's always chances of conceiving. I really don't know how the medication would affect your ability to conceive. It all depends on the medication he is taking, but you definitely need to speak with your doctor and give him/her the names of the medications, just to be sure. I know that some do have an effect on the sperm. Good luck.

Google the meds that hes on an look up side effects.  My husband is 25 but he has a pace maker an a defibulater.  He has had it since he was 17.  He takes 7 pills a day.  So we had a harder time getting pregnant.  But I'm 27 weeks now so needless to say its possible.  An as for the age thing... I used to work in a nursing home years ago.  An there were several men in there that had babies when they were "up there" in age.  I hope this helps.  Anita

question: I am 30 and my husband is 67.  He has two children from his first marriage.  I have never been pregnant.  He had open heart surgery about 10 years ago and he is on prescription medication for that & diabetes, high blood pressure & cholesterol.  I need to know how this will affect our chances of conceiving?  Thank you in advance!
title: Will my husband's age and medications influence our chances of conceiving?
